content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the position of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, t to the fourth power, minus 4 times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the acceleration of the particle when the velocity of the particle is <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
